!!Hiring!!Lead Dot Net Developer(Day 1 Onsite)Any Visa(USA)No C2C or 3rd party(Dont waste your time)Immediate InterviewRequired:• Experience working with development technologies including Microsoft.NET (C#), ASP.NET/MVC, WCF/WebAPI, SQL Server, JavaScript frameworks (Angular, Durandal, Knockout, etc.), REST, XML, JSON, HTML, Python, GIS Frameworks, and CSS (8+ years);• Experience as a lead developer (5+ years)Preferred:• Experience with Scrum, SAFe, DAD, or other agile approachResponsibilities include but are not limited to the following:• Working as a senior developer on various cross-functional application projects, ensuring that robust and scalable solutions are implemented• Collaborating with other team members and Subject Matter Experts to ensure solutions are implemented according to customer requirements• Taking responsibility for full lifecycle application development• Ensuring code is written to implement the architecture and design such that it meets standards in terms of code quality and efficiency• Fully unit testing all solutions prior to User Acceptance Testing and implementation• Initiating, driving and delivering effective experiences in partnership with distributed cross-functional teams to ensure all aspects of the architectural vision are communicated, supported and delivered to the highest standards; aligning core.NET based platform development initiatives with Department development vision, strategy and deployment• Developing and applying knowledge of trends, relevant software development technologies and methodologies.Why apply?• Join a company that provides multiple ways to retain great skills and talent: part-time employees have opportunities to become full-time, and skilled temporary employees can become permanent;• Work with a great team of professionals in a friendly and supportive work environment where management provides all needed direction without micromanagement;• Work in a safe and secure location with an onsite data center and major dining options within walking distance;• Benefit from multiple project extensions;• Get an opportunity to work extra hours to increase your bi-weekly paycheck;• Receive support and advice from Vitaver consultants who are already working at our Client’s site;• Get extra cash by participating in the Vitaver Successful Completion Bonus Program;• Always get paid in full and on time.Please reach to kumar@hivesoftsolutions.comhashtag#DOTNET hashtag#LEAD hashtag#USA hashtag#FLORIDA hashtag#HIRING hashtag#NOC2C hashtag#CAREERS

Interceptores 💡 Me tope con el uso de interceptores en distintos proyectos, y me pareció de suma utilidad.Los interceptores en Entity Framework Core permiten capturar y modificar operaciones de base de datos antes o después de que ocurran. Son ideales para auditar, loguear, o incluso modificar consultas en tiempo de ejecución sin afectar la lógica del repositorio.📌 Cuándo usarlo:✔️ Para registrar consultas lentas o detectar ineficiencias✔️ Implementar lógica de auditoría sin modificar el código del repositorio✔️ Evitar SQL Injection validando consultas antes de ejecutarlasEn mi caso, fue clave para identificar consultas que sobrecargaban la cpu del servidor y que requerian algun rediseño para evitarlo.------------------------------------------------------------------------------Interceptors 💡Entity Framework Core interceptors allow you to capture and modify database operations before or after they occur. They are ideal for auditing, logging, or even modifying queries at runtime without affecting repository logic.📌 When to use it:✔️ To log slow queries or detect inefficiencies✔️ Implement audit logic without modifying the repository code✔️ Avoid SQL Injection by validating queries before executing themIn my case, it was key to identifying queries that were overloading the server's CPU and that required some redesign to avoid it.hashtag#Interceptors hashtag#NET hashtag#C hashtag#EntityFramework

Interceptores 💡 Me tope con el uso de interceptores en distintos proyectos, y me pareció de suma utilidad.Los interceptores en Entity Framework Core permiten capturar y modificar operaciones de base de datos antes o después de que ocurran. Son ideales para auditar, loguear, o incluso modificar consultas en tiempo de ejecución sin afectar la lógica del repositorio.📌 Cuándo usarlo:✔️ Para registrar consultas lentas o detectar ineficiencias✔️ Implementar lógica de auditoría sin modificar el código del repositorio✔️ Evitar SQL Injection validando consultas antes de ejecutarlasEn mi caso, fue clave para identificar consultas que sobrecargaban la cpu del servidor y que requerian algun rediseño para evitarlo.------------------------------------------------------------------------------Interceptors 💡Entity Framework Core interceptors allow you to capture and modify database operations before or after they occur. They are ideal for auditing, logging, or even modifying queries at runtime without affecting repository logic.📌 When to use it:✔️ To log slow queries or detect inefficiencies✔️ Implement audit logic without modifying the repository code✔️ Avoid SQL Injection by validating queries before executing themIn my case, it was key to identifying queries that were overloading the server's CPU and that required some redesign to avoid it.hashtag#Interceptors hashtag#NET hashtag#C hashtag#EntityFramework

Interceptores 💡 Me tope con el uso de interceptores en distintos proyectos, y me pareció de suma utilidad.Los interceptores en Entity Framework Core permiten capturar y modificar operaciones de base de datos antes o después de que ocurran. Son ideales para auditar, loguear, o incluso modificar consultas en tiempo de ejecución sin afectar la lógica del repositorio.📌 Cuándo usarlo:✔️ Para registrar consultas lentas o detectar ineficiencias✔️ Implementar lógica de auditoría sin modificar el código del repositorio✔️ Evitar SQL Injection validando consultas antes de ejecutarlasEn mi caso, fue clave para identificar consultas que sobrecargaban la cpu del servidor y que requerian algun rediseño para evitarlo.------------------------------------------------------------------------------Interceptors 💡Entity Framework Core interceptors allow you to capture and modify database operations before or after they occur. They are ideal for auditing, logging, or even modifying queries at runtime without affecting repository logic.📌 When to use it:✔️ To log slow queries or detect inefficiencies✔️ Implement audit logic without modifying the repository code✔️ Avoid SQL Injection by validating queries before executing themIn my case, it was key to identifying queries that were overloading the server's CPU and that required some redesign to avoid it.hashtag#Interceptors hashtag#NET hashtag#C hashtag#EntityFramework

Interceptores 💡 Me tope con el uso de interceptores en distintos proyectos, y me pareció de suma utilidad.Los interceptores en Entity Framework Core permiten capturar y modificar operaciones de base de datos antes o después de que ocurran. Son ideales para auditar, loguear, o incluso modificar consultas en tiempo de ejecución sin afectar la lógica del repositorio.📌 Cuándo usarlo:✔️ Para registrar consultas lentas o detectar ineficiencias✔️ Implementar lógica de auditoría sin modificar el código del repositorio✔️ Evitar SQL Injection validando consultas antes de ejecutarlasEn mi caso, fue clave para identificar consultas que sobrecargaban la cpu del servidor y que requerian algun rediseño para evitarlo.------------------------------------------------------------------------------Interceptors 💡Entity Framework Core interceptors allow you to capture and modify database operations before or after they occur. They are ideal for auditing, logging, or even modifying queries at runtime without affecting repository logic.📌 When to use it:✔️ To log slow queries or detect inefficiencies✔️ Implement audit logic without modifying the repository code✔️ Avoid SQL Injection by validating queries before executing themIn my case, it was key to identifying queries that were overloading the server's CPU and that required some redesign to avoid it.hashtag#Interceptors hashtag#NET hashtag#C hashtag#EntityFramework

Interceptores 💡 Me tope con el uso de interceptores en distintos proyectos, y me pareció de suma utilidad.Los interceptores en Entity Framework Core permiten capturar y modificar operaciones de base de datos antes o después de que ocurran. Son ideales para auditar, loguear, o incluso modificar consultas en tiempo de ejecución sin afectar la lógica del repositorio.📌 Cuándo usarlo:✔️ Para registrar consultas lentas o detectar ineficiencias✔️ Implementar lógica de auditoría sin modificar el código del repositorio✔️ Evitar SQL Injection validando consultas antes de ejecutarlasEn mi caso, fue clave para identificar consultas que sobrecargaban la cpu del servidor y que requerian algun rediseño para evitarlo.------------------------------------------------------------------------------Interceptors 💡Entity Framework Core interceptors allow you to capture and modify database operations before or after they occur. They are ideal for auditing, logging, or even modifying queries at runtime without affecting repository logic.📌 When to use it:✔️ To log slow queries or detect inefficiencies✔️ Implement audit logic without modifying the repository code✔️ Avoid SQL Injection by validating queries before executing themIn my case, it was key to identifying queries that were overloading the server's CPU and that required some redesign to avoid it.hashtag#Interceptors hashtag#NET hashtag#C hashtag#EntityFramework

Interceptores 💡 Me tope con el uso de interceptores en distintos proyectos, y me pareció de suma utilidad.Los interceptores en Entity Framework Core permiten capturar y modificar operaciones de base de datos antes o después de que ocurran. Son ideales para auditar, loguear, o incluso modificar consultas en tiempo de ejecución sin afectar la lógica del repositorio.📌 Cuándo usarlo:✔️ Para registrar consultas lentas o detectar ineficiencias✔️ Implementar lógica de auditoría sin modificar el código del repositorio✔️ Evitar SQL Injection validando consultas antes de ejecutarlasEn mi caso, fue clave para identificar consultas que sobrecargaban la cpu del servidor y que requerian algun rediseño para evitarlo.------------------------------------------------------------------------------Interceptors 💡Entity Framework Core interceptors allow you to capture and modify database operations before or after they occur. They are ideal for auditing, logging, or even modifying queries at runtime without affecting repository logic.📌 When to use it:✔️ To log slow queries or detect inefficiencies✔️ Implement audit logic without modifying the repository code✔️ Avoid SQL Injection by validating queries before executing themIn my case, it was key to identifying queries that were overloading the server's CPU and that required some redesign to avoid it.hashtag#Interceptors hashtag#NET hashtag#C hashtag#EntityFramework

Interceptores 💡 Me tope con el uso de interceptores en distintos proyectos, y me pareció de suma utilidad.Los interceptores en Entity Framework Core permiten capturar y modificar operaciones de base de datos antes o después de que ocurran. Son ideales para auditar, loguear, o incluso modificar consultas en tiempo de ejecución sin afectar la lógica del repositorio.📌 Cuándo usarlo:✔️ Para registrar consultas lentas o detectar ineficiencias✔️ Implementar lógica de auditoría sin modificar el código del repositorio✔️ Evitar SQL Injection validando consultas antes de ejecutarlasEn mi caso, fue clave para identificar consultas que sobrecargaban la cpu del servidor y que requerian algun rediseño para evitarlo.------------------------------------------------------------------------------Interceptors 💡Entity Framework Core interceptors allow you to capture and modify database operations before or after they occur. They are ideal for auditing, logging, or even modifying queries at runtime without affecting repository logic.📌 When to use it:✔️ To log slow queries or detect inefficiencies✔️ Implement audit logic without modifying the repository code✔️ Avoid SQL Injection by validating queries before executing themIn my case, it was key to identifying queries that were overloading the server's CPU and that required some redesign to avoid it.hashtag#Interceptors hashtag#NET hashtag#C hashtag#EntityFramework

Interceptores 💡 Me tope con el uso de interceptores en distintos proyectos, y me pareció de suma utilidad.Los interceptores en Entity Framework Core permiten capturar y modificar operaciones de base de datos antes o después de que ocurran. Son ideales para auditar, loguear, o incluso modificar consultas en tiempo de ejecución sin afectar la lógica del repositorio.📌 Cuándo usarlo:✔️ Para registrar consultas lentas o detectar ineficiencias✔️ Implementar lógica de auditoría sin modificar el código del repositorio✔️ Evitar SQL Injection validando consultas antes de ejecutarlasEn mi caso, fue clave para identificar consultas que sobrecargaban la cpu del servidor y que requerian algun rediseño para evitarlo.------------------------------------------------------------------------------Interceptors 💡Entity Framework Core interceptors allow you to capture and modify database operations before or after they occur. They are ideal for auditing, logging, or even modifying queries at runtime without affecting repository logic.📌 When to use it:✔️ To log slow queries or detect inefficiencies✔️ Implement audit logic without modifying the repository code✔️ Avoid SQL Injection by validating queries before executing themIn my case, it was key to identifying queries that were overloading the server's CPU and that required some redesign to avoid it.hashtag#Interceptors hashtag#NET hashtag#C hashtag#EntityFramework

Interceptores 💡 Me tope con el uso de interceptores en distintos proyectos, y me pareció de suma utilidad.Los interceptores en Entity Framework Core permiten capturar y modificar operaciones de base de datos antes o después de que ocurran. Son ideales para auditar, loguear, o incluso modificar consultas en tiempo de ejecución sin afectar la lógica del repositorio.📌 Cuándo usarlo:✔️ Para registrar consultas lentas o detectar ineficiencias✔️ Implementar lógica de auditoría sin modificar el código del repositorio✔️ Evitar SQL Injection validando consultas antes de ejecutarlasEn mi caso, fue clave para identificar consultas que sobrecargaban la cpu del servidor y que requerian algun rediseño para evitarlo.------------------------------------------------------------------------------Interceptors 💡Entity Framework Core interceptors allow you to capture and modify database operations before or after they occur. They are ideal for auditing, logging, or even modifying queries at runtime without affecting repository logic.📌 When to use it:✔️ To log slow queries or detect inefficiencies✔️ Implement audit logic without modifying the repository code✔️ Avoid SQL Injection by validating queries before executing themIn my case, it was key to identifying queries that were overloading the server's CPU and that required some redesign to avoid it.hashtag#Interceptors hashtag#NET hashtag#C hashtag#EntityFramework

When you - as I am - are on a job hunt (or selling to new clients) it is always interesting to see, who will pick up the phone when you give a call to busy senior leaders in busy companies. I must say, that it has been a very positive experience. February has been busy with coffee meetings, and great contacts in the network. Thank you to all coffee meeting participants (leaders and companies) for your advice and time. Also many thanks to all of you who have liked, shared and written comments, called me and provided ideas, leads and support in many other ways (also from colleagues). I have learned that the wider the "Open for New Opportunities" LinkedIn post can be shared the better. I have also learned that a personal/physical 1:1 meeting between people is still highly valuableThe ongoing talks have provided me with good memories - and new magic moments  -  when reconnecting with network relations, new business contacts, headhunters and people who I - in some cases - may not have seen for a while. The positive dialogues are much appreciated. Today Partner Bettina Bencke, and Manager Birthe Bülow from Bencke & Partners, who are working with headhunting and recruiting, kindly hosted a coffee meeting in central Copenhagen. Interceptores 💡 Me tope con el uso de interceptores en distintos proyectos, y me pareció de suma utilidad.Los interceptores en Entity Framework Core permiten capturar y modificar operaciones de base de datos antes o después de que ocurran. Son ideales para auditar, loguear, o incluso modificar consultas en tiempo de ejecución sin afectar la lógica del repositorio.📌 Cuándo usarlo:✔️ Para registrar consultas lentas o detectar ineficiencias✔️ Implementar lógica de auditoría sin modificar el código del repositorio✔️ Evitar SQL Injection validando consultas antes de ejecutarlasEn mi caso, fue clave para identificar consultas que sobrecargaban la cpu del servidor y que requerian algun rediseño para evitarlo.------------------------------------------------------------------------------Interceptors 💡Entity Framework Core interceptors allow you to capture and modify database operations before or after they occur. They are ideal for auditing, logging, or even modifying queries at runtime without affecting repository logic.📌 When to use it:✔️ To log slow queries or detect inefficiencies✔️ Implement audit logic without modifying the repository code✔️ Avoid SQL Injection by validating queries before executing themIn my case, it was key to identifying queries that were overloading the server's CPU and that required some redesign to avoid it.hashtag#Interceptors hashtag#NET hashtag#C hashtag#EntityFramework

When you - as I am - are on a job hunt (or selling to new clients) it is always interesting to see, who will pick up the phone when you give a call to busy senior leaders in busy companies. I must say, that it has been a very positive experience. February has been busy with coffee meetings, and great contacts in the network. Thank you to all coffee meeting participants (leaders and companies) for your advice and time. Also many thanks to all of you who have liked, shared and written comments, called me and provided ideas, leads and support in many other ways (also from colleagues). I have learned that the wider the "Open for New Opportunities" LinkedIn post can be shared the better. I have also learned that a personal/physical 1:1 meeting between people is still highly valuableThe ongoing talks have provided me with good memories - and new magic moments  -  when reconnecting with network relations, new business contacts, headhunters and people who I - in some cases - may not have seen for a while. The positive dialogues are much appreciated. Today Partner Bettina Bencke, and Manager Birthe Bülow from Bencke & Partners, who are working with headhunting and recruiting, kindly hosted a coffee meeting in central Copenhagen. Thank you to Birthe Bülow for providing inspiration, professional insights and excellent advice for the continued journey towards the next job, within one of the following areas, as described on my LinkedIn profile:1) General management of business units/teams 2) Project management of multi-disciplinary technology/business projects or business transformations with organisational development3) Business development, clients, sales, tenders and growthOpen for New Opportunities post on LinkedIn:https://lnkd.in/dgVXCwFmFurther info can be found on my LinkedIn profile: "International business man with strong market, technology and communication skills". https://lnkd.in/drKa-cFT

Interceptores 💡 Me tope con el uso de interceptores en distintos proyectos, y me pareció de suma utilidad.Los interceptores en Entity Framework Core permiten capturar y modificar operaciones de base de datos antes o después de que ocurran. Son ideales para auditar, loguear, o incluso modificar consultas en tiempo de ejecución sin afectar la lógica del repositorio.📌 Cuándo usarlo:✔️ Para registrar consultas lentas o detectar ineficiencias✔️ Implementar lógica de auditoría sin modificar el código del repositorio✔️ Evitar SQL Injection validando consultas antes de ejecutarlasEn mi caso, fue clave para identificar consultas que sobrecargaban la cpu del servidor y que requerian algun rediseño para evitarlo.------------------------------------------------------------------------------Interceptors 💡Entity Framework Core interceptors allow you to capture and modify database operations before or after they occur. They are ideal for auditing, logging, or even modifying queries at runtime without affecting repository logic.📌 When to use it:✔️ To log slow queries or detect inefficiencies✔️ Implement audit logic without modifying the repository code✔️ Avoid SQL Injection by validating queries before executing themIn my case, it was key to identifying queries that were overloading the server's CPU and that required some redesign to avoid it.hashtag#Interceptors hashtag#NET hashtag#C hashtag#EntityFramework

When you - as I am - are on a job hunt (or selling to new clients) it is always interesting to see, who will pick up the phone when you give a call to busy senior leaders in busy companies. I must say, that it has been a very positive experience. February has been busy with coffee meetings, and great contacts in the network. Thank you to all coffee meeting participants (leaders and companies) for your advice and time. Also many thanks to all of you who have liked, shared and written comments, called me and provided ideas, leads and support in many other ways (also from colleagues). I have learned that the wider the "Open for New Opportunities" LinkedIn post can be shared the better. I have also learned that a personal/physical 1:1 meeting between people is still highly valuableThe ongoing talks have provided me with good memories - and new magic moments  -  when reconnecting with network relations, new business contacts, headhunters and people who I - in some cases - may not have seen for a while. The positive dialogues are much appreciated. Today Partner Bettina Bencke, and Manager Birthe Bülow from Bencke & Partners, who are working with headhunting and recruiting, kindly hosted a coffee meeting in central Copenhagen. Thank you to Birthe Bülow for providing inspiration, professional insights and excellent advice for the continued journey towards the next job, within one of the following areas, as described on my LinkedIn profile:1) General management of business units/teams 2) Project management of multi-disciplinary technology/business projects or business transformations with organisational development3) Business development, clients, sales, tenders and growthOpen for New Opportunities post on LinkedIn:https://lnkd.in/dgVXCwFmFurther info can be found on my LinkedIn profile: "International business man with strong market, technology and communication skills". https://lnkd.in/drKa-cFT

Interceptores 💡 Me tope con el uso de interceptores en distintos proyectos, y me pareció de suma utilidad.Los interceptores en Entity Framework Core permiten capturar y modificar operaciones de base de datos antes o después de que ocurran. Son ideales para auditar, loguear, o incluso modificar consultas en tiempo de ejecución sin afectar la lógica del repositorio.📌 Cuándo usarlo:✔️ Para registrar consultas lentas o detectar ineficiencias✔️ Implementar lógica de auditoría sin modificar el código del repositorio✔️ Evitar SQL Injection validando consultas antes de ejecutarlasEn mi caso, fue clave para identificar consultas que sobrecargaban la cpu del servidor y que requerian algun rediseño para evitarlo.------------------------------------------------------------------------------Interceptors 💡Entity Framework Core interceptors allow you to capture and modify database operations before or after they occur. They are ideal for auditing, logging, or even modifying queries at runtime without affecting repository logic.📌 When to use it:✔️ To log slow queries or detect inefficiencies✔️ Implement audit logic without modifying the repository code✔️ Avoid SQL Injection by validating queries before executing themIn my case, it was key to identifying queries that were overloading the server's CPU and that required some redesign to avoid it.hashtag#Interceptors hashtag#NET hashtag#C hashtag#EntityFramework

When you - as I am - are on a job hunt (or selling to new clients) it is always interesting to see, who will pick up the phone when you give a call to busy senior leaders in busy companies. I must say, that it has been a very positive experience. February has been busy with coffee meetings, and great contacts in the network. Thank you to all coffee meeting participants (leaders and companies) for your advice and time. Also many thanks to all of you who have liked, shared and written comments, called me and provided ideas, leads and support in many other ways (also from colleagues). I have learned that the wider the "Open for New Opportunities" LinkedIn post can be shared the better. I have also learned that a personal/physical 1:1 meeting between people is still highly valuableThe ongoing talks have provided me with good memories - and new magic moments  -  when reconnecting with network relations, new business contacts, headhunters and people who I - in some cases - may not have seen for a while. The positive dialogues are much appreciated. Today Partner Bettina Bencke, and Manager Birthe Bülow from Bencke & Partners, who are working with headhunting and recruiting, kindly hosted a coffee meeting in central Copenhagen. Thank you to Birthe Bülow for providing inspiration, professional insights and excellent advice for the continued journey towards the next job, within one of the following areas, as described on my LinkedIn profile:1) General management of business units/teams 2) Project management of multi-disciplinary technology/business projects or business transformations with organisational development3) Business development, clients, sales, tenders and growthOpen for New Opportunities post on LinkedIn:https://lnkd.in/dgVXCwFmFurther info can be found on my LinkedIn profile: "International business man with strong market, technology and communication skills". https://lnkd.in/drKa-cFT

Mastering hashtag#FullStackDevelopment with hashtag#Django!Web development has come a long way, and so has my journey with it! From building my first website in 1998 for Stow Heath Primary School (thanks to Dave Whyley and Gavin Hawkins) to teaching dynamic web design at Bilston College in 1999, I’ve seen the industry evolve drastically. Back then, I self-learned ASP.NET and PHP, CSS, HTML, Javscript, HCI, etc teaching HND and Foundation Degree courses at the City of Wolverhampton College and the University of Wolverhampton having held the youngest lecture accolade too.Fast forward to today, and building full-stack web applications has never been easier! Got me thinking I have not produced a CV in a long time - and I was asked to showcase my experience. Well being self-taught in web I have no certificates. But I have served as an External Examiner (EV) and Internal Verifier (IV)  and OSCA for multiple institutions, including the University of Wolverhampton, Birmingham City University, Kingston University, and University of Surrey (BSc Top-Up programs) and Pearson, NCFE exam boards and written Degree modules. Plus I have worked on Innovate UK government-funded projects, developing websites for businesses and contributing to technology innovation and digital transformation. Today it's important to have certificates...Why Learn Full-Stack Development?🔹 Django Framework – A powerful backend for scalable applications🔹 APIs & Integrations – Connecting systems efficiently🔹 Automated Testing – Ensuring stability and reliability🔹 Persistent Storage – Managing relational and non-relational databases🔹 User Authentication – Securing access with login systems🔹 E-Commerce Functionality – Implementing seamless transactionsThe demand for web application development skills is growing as hashtag#AI and data-driven applications transform industries. Securing a career in this field means staying ahead of the curve.The Future of Work is Digital 💡📌 46% of UK businesses struggle to recruit due to a lack of digital skills (UK Parliament)📌 £47K+ – The average UK software developer salary (Indeed)📌 85 million jobs are at risk of automation (World Economic Forum)At ThirdWaveICT, we build full-stack websites, static websites, and apps, if you're looking for expertise, let’s connect! If you’re exploring Django and full-stack development, I’d love to share insights.📢 Want to future-proof your career?Become a highly employable software developer in the UK with a globally recognised Level 5 hashtag#Diploma in hashtag#Web hashtag#Applications hashtag#Development → Code Institute South Staffordshire College soon City of Wolverhampton College lals@wolvcoll.ac.uk hashtag#WebDevelopment hashtag#Python hashtag#ECommerce hashtag#APIs hashtag#Automation hashtag#TechCareers hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#CareerGrowth

Interceptores 💡 Me tope con el uso de interceptores en distintos proyectos, y me pareció de suma utilidad.Los interceptores en Entity Framework Core permiten capturar y modificar operaciones de base de datos antes o después de que ocurran. Son ideales para auditar, loguear, o incluso modificar consultas en tiempo de ejecución sin afectar la lógica del repositorio.📌 Cuándo usarlo:✔️ Para registrar consultas lentas o detectar ineficiencias✔️ Implementar lógica de auditoría sin modificar el código del repositorio✔️ Evitar SQL Injection validando consultas antes de ejecutarlasEn mi caso, fue clave para identificar consultas que sobrecargaban la cpu del servidor y que requerian algun rediseño para evitarlo.------------------------------------------------------------------------------Interceptors 💡Entity Framework Core interceptors allow you to capture and modify database operations before or after they occur. They are ideal for auditing, logging, or even modifying queries at runtime without affecting repository logic.📌 When to use it:✔️ To log slow queries or detect inefficiencies✔️ Implement audit logic without modifying the repository code✔️ Avoid SQL Injection by validating queries before executing themIn my case, it was key to identifying queries that were overloading the server's CPU and that required some redesign to avoid it.hashtag#Interceptors hashtag#NET hashtag#C hashtag#EntityFramework

When you - as I am - are on a job hunt (or selling to new clients) it is always interesting to see, who will pick up the phone when you give a call to busy senior leaders in busy companies. I must say, that it has been a very positive experience. February has been busy with coffee meetings, and great contacts in the network. Thank you to all coffee meeting participants (leaders and companies) for your advice and time. Also many thanks to all of you who have liked, shared and written comments, called me and provided ideas, leads and support in many other ways (also from colleagues). I have learned that the wider the "Open for New Opportunities" LinkedIn post can be shared the better. I have also learned that a personal/physical 1:1 meeting between people is still highly valuableThe ongoing talks have provided me with good memories - and new magic moments  -  when reconnecting with network relations, new business contacts, headhunters and people who I - in some cases - may not have seen for a while. The positive dialogues are much appreciated. Today Partner Bettina Bencke, and Manager Birthe Bülow from Bencke & Partners, who are working with headhunting and recruiting, kindly hosted a coffee meeting in central Copenhagen. Thank you to Birthe Bülow for providing inspiration, professional insights and excellent advice for the continued journey towards the next job, within one of the following areas, as described on my LinkedIn profile:1) General management of business units/teams 2) Project management of multi-disciplinary technology/business projects or business transformations with organisational development3) Business development, clients, sales, tenders and growthOpen for New Opportunities post on LinkedIn:https://lnkd.in/dgVXCwFmFurther info can be found on my LinkedIn profile: "International business man with strong market, technology and communication skills". https://lnkd.in/drKa-cFT

Mastering hashtag#FullStackDevelopment with hashtag#Django!Web development has come a long way, and so has my journey with it! From building my first website in 1998 for Stow Heath Primary School (thanks to Dave Whyley and Gavin Hawkins) to teaching dynamic web design at Bilston College in 1999, I’ve seen the industry evolve drastically. Back then, I self-learned ASP.NET and PHP, CSS, HTML, Javscript, HCI, etc teaching HND and Foundation Degree courses at the City of Wolverhampton College and the University of Wolverhampton having held the youngest lecture accolade too.Fast forward to today, and building full-stack web applications has never been easier! Got me thinking I have not produced a CV in a long time - and I was asked to showcase my experience. Well being self-taught in web I have no certificates. But I have served as an External Examiner (EV) and Internal Verifier (IV)  and OSCA for multiple institutions, including the University of Wolverhampton, Birmingham City University, Kingston University, and University of Surrey (BSc Top-Up programs) and Pearson, NCFE exam boards and written Degree modules. Plus I have worked on Innovate UK government-funded projects, developing websites for businesses and contributing to technology innovation and digital transformation. Today it's important to have certificates...Why Learn Full-Stack Development?🔹 Django Framework – A powerful backend for scalable applications🔹 APIs & Integrations – Connecting systems efficiently🔹 Automated Testing – Ensuring stability and reliability🔹 Persistent Storage – Managing relational and non-relational databases🔹 User Authentication – Securing access with login systems🔹 E-Commerce Functionality – Implementing seamless transactionsThe demand for web application development skills is growing as hashtag#AI and data-driven applications transform industries. Securing a career in this field means staying ahead of the curve.The Future of Work is Digital 💡📌 46% of UK businesses struggle to recruit due to a lack of digital skills (UK Parliament)📌 £47K+ – The average UK software developer salary (Indeed)📌 85 million jobs are at risk of automation (World Economic Forum)At ThirdWaveICT, we build full-stack websites, static websites, and apps, if you're looking for expertise, let’s connect! If you’re exploring Django and full-stack development, I’d love to share insights.📢 Want to future-proof your career?Become a highly employable software developer in the UK with a globally recognised Level 5 hashtag#Diploma in hashtag#Web hashtag#Applications hashtag#Development → Code Institute South Staffordshire College soon City of Wolverhampton College lals@wolvcoll.ac.uk hashtag#WebDevelopment hashtag#Python hashtag#ECommerce hashtag#APIs hashtag#Automation hashtag#TechCareers hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#CareerGrowth

Interceptores 💡 Me tope con el uso de interceptores en distintos proyectos, y me pareció de suma utilidad.Los interceptores en Entity Framework Core permiten capturar y modificar operaciones de base de datos antes o después de que ocurran. Son ideales para auditar, loguear, o incluso modificar consultas en tiempo de ejecución sin afectar la lógica del repositorio.📌 Cuándo usarlo:✔️ Para registrar consultas lentas o detectar ineficiencias✔️ Implementar lógica de auditoría sin modificar el código del repositorio✔️ Evitar SQL Injection validando consultas antes de ejecutarlasEn mi caso, fue clave para identificar consultas que sobrecargaban la cpu del servidor y que requerian algun rediseño para evitarlo.------------------------------------------------------------------------------Interceptors 💡Entity Framework Core interceptors allow you to capture and modify database operations before or after they occur. They are ideal for auditing, logging, or even modifying queries at runtime without affecting repository logic.📌 When to use it:✔️ To log slow queries or detect inefficiencies✔️ Implement audit logic without modifying the repository code✔️ Avoid SQL Injection by validating queries before executing themIn my case, it was key to identifying queries that were overloading the server's CPU and that required some redesign to avoid it.hashtag#Interceptors hashtag#NET hashtag#C hashtag#EntityFramework

When you - as I am - are on a job hunt (or selling to new clients) it is always interesting to see, who will pick up the phone when you give a call to busy senior leaders in busy companies. I must say, that it has been a very positive experience. February has been busy with coffee meetings, and great contacts in the network. Thank you to all coffee meeting participants (leaders and companies) for your advice and time. Also many thanks to all of you who have liked, shared and written comments, called me and provided ideas, leads and support in many other ways (also from colleagues). I have learned that the wider the "Open for New Opportunities" LinkedIn post can be shared the better. I have also learned that a personal/physical 1:1 meeting between people is still highly valuableThe ongoing talks have provided me with good memories - and new magic moments  -  when reconnecting with network relations, new business contacts, headhunters and people who I - in some cases - may not have seen for a while. The positive dialogues are much appreciated. Today Partner Bettina Bencke, and Manager Birthe Bülow from Bencke & Partners, who are working with headhunting and recruiting, kindly hosted a coffee meeting in central Copenhagen. Thank you to Birthe Bülow for providing inspiration, professional insights and excellent advice for the continued journey towards the next job, within one of the following areas, as described on my LinkedIn profile:1) General management of business units/teams 2) Project management of multi-disciplinary technology/business projects or business transformations with organisational development3) Business development, clients, sales, tenders and growthOpen for New Opportunities post on LinkedIn:https://lnkd.in/dgVXCwFmFurther info can be found on my LinkedIn profile: "International business man with strong market, technology and communication skills". https://lnkd.in/drKa-cFT

Mastering hashtag#FullStackDevelopment with hashtag#Django!Web development has come a long way, and so has my journey with it! From building my first website in 1998 for Stow Heath Primary School (thanks to Dave Whyley and Gavin Hawkins) to teaching dynamic web design at Bilston College in 1999, I’ve seen the industry evolve drastically. Back then, I self-learned ASP.NET and PHP, CSS, HTML, Javscript, HCI, etc teaching HND and Foundation Degree courses at the City of Wolverhampton College and the University of Wolverhampton having held the youngest lecture accolade too.Fast forward to today, and building full-stack web applications has never been easier! Got me thinking I have not produced a CV in a long time - and I was asked to showcase my experience. Well being self-taught in web I have no certificates. But I have served as an External Examiner (EV) and Internal Verifier (IV)  and OSCA for multiple institutions, including the University of Wolverhampton, Birmingham City University, Kingston University, and University of Surrey (BSc Top-Up programs) and Pearson, NCFE exam boards and written Degree modules. Plus I have worked on Innovate UK government-funded projects, developing websites for businesses and contributing to technology innovation and digital transformation. Today it's important to have certificates...Why Learn Full-Stack Development?🔹 Django Framework – A powerful backend for scalable applications🔹 APIs & Integrations – Connecting systems efficiently🔹 Automated Testing – Ensuring stability and reliability🔹 Persistent Storage – Managing relational and non-relational databases🔹 User Authentication – Securing access with login systems🔹 E-Commerce Functionality – Implementing seamless transactionsThe demand for web application development skills is growing as hashtag#AI and data-driven applications transform industries. Securing a career in this field means staying ahead of the curve.The Future of Work is Digital 💡📌 46% of UK businesses struggle to recruit due to a lack of digital skills (UK Parliament)📌 £47K+ – The average UK software developer salary (Indeed)📌 85 million jobs are at risk of automation (World Economic Forum)At ThirdWaveICT, we build full-stack websites, static websites, and apps, if you're looking for expertise, let’s connect! If you’re exploring Django and full-stack development, I’d love to share insights.📢 Want to future-proof your career?Become a highly employable software developer in the UK with a globally recognised Level 5 hashtag#Diploma in hashtag#Web hashtag#Applications hashtag#Development → Code Institute South Staffordshire College soon City of Wolverhampton College lals@wolvcoll.ac.uk hashtag#WebDevelopment hashtag#Python hashtag#ECommerce hashtag#APIs hashtag#Automation hashtag#TechCareers hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#CareerGrowth

Interceptores 💡 Me tope con el uso de interceptores en distintos proyectos, y me pareció de suma utilidad.Los interceptores en Entity Framework Core permiten capturar y modificar operaciones de base de datos antes o después de que ocurran. Son ideales para auditar, loguear, o incluso modificar consultas en tiempo de ejecución sin afectar la lógica del repositorio.📌 Cuándo usarlo:✔️ Para registrar consultas lentas o detectar ineficiencias✔️ Implementar lógica de auditoría sin modificar el código del repositorio✔️ Evitar SQL Injection validando consultas antes de ejecutarlasEn mi caso, fue clave para identificar consultas que sobrecargaban la cpu del servidor y que requerian algun rediseño para evitarlo.------------------------------------------------------------------------------Interceptors 💡Entity Framework Core interceptors allow you to capture and modify database operations before or after they occur. They are ideal for auditing, logging, or even modifying queries at runtime without affecting repository logic.📌 When to use it:✔️ To log slow queries or detect inefficiencies✔️ Implement audit logic without modifying the repository code✔️ Avoid SQL Injection by validating queries before executing themIn my case, it was key to identifying queries that were overloading the server's CPU and that required some redesign to avoid it.hashtag#Interceptors hashtag#NET hashtag#C hashtag#EntityFramework

When you - as I am - are on a job hunt (or selling to new clients) it is always interesting to see, who will pick up the phone when you give a call to busy senior leaders in busy companies. I must say, that it has been a very positive experience. February has been busy with coffee meetings, and great contacts in the network. Thank you to all coffee meeting participants (leaders and companies) for your advice and time. Also many thanks to all of you who have liked, shared and written comments, called me and provided ideas, leads and support in many other ways (also from colleagues). I have learned that the wider the "Open for New Opportunities" LinkedIn post can be shared the better. I have also learned that a personal/physical 1:1 meeting between people is still highly valuableThe ongoing talks have provided me with good memories - and new magic moments  -  when reconnecting with network relations, new business contacts, headhunters and people who I - in some cases - may not have seen for a while. The positive dialogues are much appreciated. Today Partner Bettina Bencke, and Manager Birthe Bülow from Bencke & Partners, who are working with headhunting and recruiting, kindly hosted a coffee meeting in central Copenhagen. Thank you to Birthe Bülow for providing inspiration, professional insights and excellent advice for the continued journey towards the next job, within one of the following areas, as described on my LinkedIn profile:1) General management of business units/teams 2) Project management of multi-disciplinary technology/business projects or business transformations with organisational development3) Business development, clients, sales, tenders and growthOpen for New Opportunities post on LinkedIn:https://lnkd.in/dgVXCwFmFurther info can be found on my LinkedIn profile: "International business man with strong market, technology and communication skills". https://lnkd.in/drKa-cFT

Mastering hashtag#FullStackDevelopment with hashtag#Django!Web development has come a long way, and so has my journey with it! From building my first website in 1998 for Stow Heath Primary School (thanks to Dave Whyley and Gavin Hawkins) to teaching dynamic web design at Bilston College in 1999, I’ve seen the industry evolve drastically. Back then, I self-learned ASP.NET and PHP, CSS, HTML, Javscript, HCI, etc teaching HND and Foundation Degree courses at the City of Wolverhampton College and the University of Wolverhampton having held the youngest lecture accolade too.Fast forward to today, and building full-stack web applications has never been easier! Got me thinking I have not produced a CV in a long time - and I was asked to showcase my experience. Well being self-taught in web I have no certificates. But I have served as an External Examiner (EV) and Internal Verifier (IV)  and OSCA for multiple institutions, including the University of Wolverhampton, Birmingham City University, Kingston University, and University of Surrey (BSc Top-Up programs) and Pearson, NCFE exam boards and written Degree modules. Plus I have worked on Innovate UK government-funded projects, developing websites for businesses and contributing to technology innovation and digital transformation. Today it's important to have certificates...Why Learn Full-Stack Development?🔹 Django Framework – A powerful backend for scalable applications🔹 APIs & Integrations – Connecting systems efficiently🔹 Automated Testing – Ensuring stability and reliability🔹 Persistent Storage – Managing relational and non-relational databases🔹 User Authentication – Securing access with login systems🔹 E-Commerce Functionality – Implementing seamless transactionsThe demand for web application development skills is growing as hashtag#AI and data-driven applications transform industries. Securing a career in this field means staying ahead of the curve.The Future of Work is Digital 💡📌 46% of UK businesses struggle to recruit due to a lack of digital skills (UK Parliament)📌 £47K+ – The average UK software developer salary (Indeed)📌 85 million jobs are at risk of automation (World Economic Forum)At ThirdWaveICT, we build full-stack websites, static websites, and apps, if you're looking for expertise, let’s connect! If you’re exploring Django and full-stack development, I’d love to share insights.📢 Want to future-proof your career?Become a highly employable software developer in the UK with a globally recognised Level 5 hashtag#Diploma in hashtag#Web hashtag#Applications hashtag#Development → Code Institute South Staffordshire College soon City of Wolverhampton College lals@wolvcoll.ac.uk hashtag#WebDevelopment hashtag#Python hashtag#ECommerce hashtag#APIs hashtag#Automation hashtag#TechCareers hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#CareerGrowth

🔥 𝗨𝘀𝗲 𝗚𝗼𝗼𝗴𝗹𝗲 𝗗𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗙𝗶𝗻𝗱 𝗝𝗼𝗯𝘀 𝗼𝗻 𝗟𝗶𝗻𝗸𝗲𝗱𝗜𝗻Most job seekers rely only on LinkedIn’s job search feature, but did you know you can find hidden job listings using Google?LinkedIn’s built-in search doesn’t always show all available jobs. That’s where Google Dorking (advanced search operators) comes in!𝗧𝗿𝘆 𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗚𝗼𝗼𝗴𝗹𝗲 𝗦𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗰𝗵 𝗤𝘂𝗲𝗿𝘆:👉 site:linkedin.com/jobs "job title" "location"🔹 𝗘𝘅𝗮𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗲:site:linkedin.com/jobs "Cybersecurity Analyst" "Gothenburg"🔹 𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗗𝗼𝗲𝘀:This tells Google to search ONLY within LinkedIn’s job postings and show results even if LinkedIn’s own algorithm hides them from you.𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝘁𝗼 𝗖𝘂𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗜𝘁 𝗙𝘂𝗿𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗿📌 Search for specific companies:site:linkedin.com/jobs "Cloud Security Engineer" "Microsoft"📌 Find jobs posted recently:site:linkedin.com/jobs "SOC Analyst" "Gothenburg" after:2024-02-01📌 Include remote jobs:site:linkedin.com/jobs "Penetration Tester" "Remote" OR "Work from Home"𝗪𝗵𝘆 𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗪𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀LinkedIn’s job search prioritizes sponsored posts and algorithm-based suggestions, meaning you might never see some job listings. Interceptores 💡 Me tope con el uso de interceptores en distintos proyectos, y me pareció de suma utilidad.Los interceptores en Entity Framework Core permiten capturar y modificar operaciones de base de datos antes o después de que ocurran. Son ideales para auditar, loguear, o incluso modificar consultas en tiempo de ejecución sin afectar la lógica del repositorio.📌 Cuándo usarlo:✔️ Para registrar consultas lentas o detectar ineficiencias✔️ Implementar lógica de auditoría sin modificar el código del repositorio✔️ Evitar SQL Injection validando consultas antes de ejecutarlasEn mi caso, fue clave para identificar consultas que sobrecargaban la cpu del servidor y que requerian algun rediseño para evitarlo.------------------------------------------------------------------------------Interceptors 💡Entity Framework Core interceptors allow you to capture and modify database operations before or after they occur. They are ideal for auditing, logging, or even modifying queries at runtime without affecting repository logic.📌 When to use it:✔️ To log slow queries or detect inefficiencies✔️ Implement audit logic without modifying the repository code✔️ Avoid SQL Injection by validating queries before executing themIn my case, it was key to identifying queries that were overloading the server's CPU and that required some redesign to avoid it.hashtag#Interceptors hashtag#NET hashtag#C hashtag#EntityFramework

When you - as I am - are on a job hunt (or selling to new clients) it is always interesting to see, who will pick up the phone when you give a call to busy senior leaders in busy companies. I must say, that it has been a very positive experience. February has been busy with coffee meetings, and great contacts in the network. Thank you to all coffee meeting participants (leaders and companies) for your advice and time. Also many thanks to all of you who have liked, shared and written comments, called me and provided ideas, leads and support in many other ways (also from colleagues). I have learned that the wider the "Open for New Opportunities" LinkedIn post can be shared the better. I have also learned that a personal/physical 1:1 meeting between people is still highly valuableThe ongoing talks have provided me with good memories - and new magic moments  -  when reconnecting with network relations, new business contacts, headhunters and people who I - in some cases - may not have seen for a while. The positive dialogues are much appreciated. Today Partner Bettina Bencke, and Manager Birthe Bülow from Bencke & Partners, who are working with headhunting and recruiting, kindly hosted a coffee meeting in central Copenhagen. Thank you to Birthe Bülow for providing inspiration, professional insights and excellent advice for the continued journey towards the next job, within one of the following areas, as described on my LinkedIn profile:1) General management of business units/teams 2) Project management of multi-disciplinary technology/business projects or business transformations with organisational development3) Business development, clients, sales, tenders and growthOpen for New Opportunities post on LinkedIn:https://lnkd.in/dgVXCwFmFurther info can be found on my LinkedIn profile: "International business man with strong market, technology and communication skills". https://lnkd.in/drKa-cFT

Mastering hashtag#FullStackDevelopment with hashtag#Django!Web development has come a long way, and so has my journey with it! From building my first website in 1998 for Stow Heath Primary School (thanks to Dave Whyley and Gavin Hawkins) to teaching dynamic web design at Bilston College in 1999, I’ve seen the industry evolve drastically. Back then, I self-learned ASP.NET and PHP, CSS, HTML, Javscript, HCI, etc teaching HND and Foundation Degree courses at the City of Wolverhampton College and the University of Wolverhampton having held the youngest lecture accolade too.Fast forward to today, and building full-stack web applications has never been easier! Got me thinking I have not produced a CV in a long time - and I was asked to showcase my experience. Well being self-taught in web I have no certificates. But I have served as an External Examiner (EV) and Internal Verifier (IV)  and OSCA for multiple institutions, including the University of Wolverhampton, Birmingham City University, Kingston University, and University of Surrey (BSc Top-Up programs) and Pearson, NCFE exam boards and written Degree modules. Plus I have worked on Innovate UK government-funded projects, developing websites for businesses and contributing to technology innovation and digital transformation. Today it's important to have certificates...Why Learn Full-Stack Development?🔹 Django Framework – A powerful backend for scalable applications🔹 APIs & Integrations – Connecting systems efficiently🔹 Automated Testing – Ensuring stability and reliability🔹 Persistent Storage – Managing relational and non-relational databases🔹 User Authentication – Securing access with login systems🔹 E-Commerce Functionality – Implementing seamless transactionsThe demand for web application development skills is growing as hashtag#AI and data-driven applications transform industries. Securing a career in this field means staying ahead of the curve.The Future of Work is Digital 💡📌 46% of UK businesses struggle to recruit due to a lack of digital skills (UK Parliament)📌 £47K+ – The average UK software developer salary (Indeed)📌 85 million jobs are at risk of automation (World Economic Forum)At ThirdWaveICT, we build full-stack websites, static websites, and apps, if you're looking for expertise, let’s connect! If you’re exploring Django and full-stack development, I’d love to share insights.📢 Want to future-proof your career?Become a highly employable software developer in the UK with a globally recognised Level 5 hashtag#Diploma in hashtag#Web hashtag#Applications hashtag#Development → Code Institute South Staffordshire College soon City of Wolverhampton College lals@wolvcoll.ac.uk hashtag#WebDevelopment hashtag#Python hashtag#ECommerce hashtag#APIs hashtag#Automation hashtag#TechCareers hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#CareerGrowth

Interceptores 💡 Me tope con el uso de interceptores en distintos proyectos, y me pareció de suma utilidad.Los interceptores en Entity Framework Core permiten capturar y modificar operaciones de base de datos antes o después de que ocurran. Son ideales para auditar, loguear, o incluso modificar consultas en tiempo de ejecución sin afectar la lógica del repositorio.📌 Cuándo usarlo:✔️ Para registrar consultas lentas o detectar ineficiencias✔️ Implementar lógica de auditoría sin modificar el código del repositorio✔️ Evitar SQL Injection validando consultas antes de ejecutarlasEn mi caso, fue clave para identificar consultas que sobrecargaban la cpu del servidor y que requerian algun rediseño para evitarlo.------------------------------------------------------------------------------Interceptors 💡Entity Framework Core interceptors allow you to capture and modify database operations before or after they occur. They are ideal for auditing, logging, or even modifying queries at runtime without affecting repository logic.📌 When to use it:✔️ To log slow queries or detect inefficiencies✔️ Implement audit logic without modifying the repository code✔️ Avoid SQL Injection by validating queries before executing themIn my case, it was key to identifying queries that were overloading the server's CPU and that required some redesign to avoid it.hashtag#Interceptors hashtag#NET hashtag#C hashtag#EntityFramework

When you - as I am - are on a job hunt (or selling to new clients) it is always interesting to see, who will pick up the phone when you give a call to busy senior leaders in busy companies. I must say, that it has been a very positive experience. February has been busy with coffee meetings, and great contacts in the network. Thank you to all coffee meeting participants (leaders and companies) for your advice and time. Also many thanks to all of you who have liked, shared and written comments, called me and provided ideas, leads and support in many other ways (also from colleagues). I have learned that the wider the "Open for New Opportunities" LinkedIn post can be shared the better. I have also learned that a personal/physical 1:1 meeting between people is still highly valuableThe ongoing talks have provided me with good memories - and new magic moments  -  when reconnecting with network relations, new business contacts, headhunters and people who I - in some cases - may not have seen for a while. The positive dialogues are much appreciated. Today Partner Bettina Bencke, and Manager Birthe Bülow from Bencke & Partners, who are working with headhunting and recruiting, kindly hosted a coffee meeting in central Copenhagen. Thank you to Birthe Bülow for providing inspiration, professional insights and excellent advice for the continued journey towards the next job, within one of the following areas, as described on my LinkedIn profile:1) General management of business units/teams 2) Project management of multi-disciplinary technology/business projects or business transformations with organisational development3) Business development, clients, sales, tenders and growthOpen for New Opportunities post on LinkedIn:https://lnkd.in/dgVXCwFmFurther info can be found on my LinkedIn profile: "International business man with strong market, technology and communication skills". https://lnkd.in/drKa-cFT

Mastering hashtag#FullStackDevelopment with hashtag#Django!Web development has come a long way, and so has my journey with it! From building my first website in 1998 for Stow Heath Primary School (thanks to Dave Whyley and Gavin Hawkins) to teaching dynamic web design at Bilston College in 1999, I’ve seen the industry evolve drastically. Back then, I self-learned ASP.NET and PHP, CSS, HTML, Javscript, HCI, etc teaching HND and Foundation Degree courses at the City of Wolverhampton College and the University of Wolverhampton having held the youngest lecture accolade too.Fast forward to today, and building full-stack web applications has never been easier! Got me thinking I have not produced a CV in a long time - and I was asked to showcase my experience. Well being self-taught in web I have no certificates. But I have served as an External Examiner (EV) and Internal Verifier (IV)  and OSCA for multiple institutions, including the University of Wolverhampton, Birmingham City University, Kingston University, and University of Surrey (BSc Top-Up programs) and Pearson, NCFE exam boards and written Degree modules. Plus I have worked on Innovate UK government-funded projects, developing websites for businesses and contributing to technology innovation and digital transformation. Today it's important to have certificates...Why Learn Full-Stack Development?🔹 Django Framework – A powerful backend for scalable applications🔹 APIs & Integrations – Connecting systems efficiently🔹 Automated Testing – Ensuring stability and reliability🔹 Persistent Storage – Managing relational and non-relational databases🔹 User Authentication – Securing access with login systems🔹 E-Commerce Functionality – Implementing seamless transactionsThe demand for web application development skills is growing as hashtag#AI and data-driven applications transform industries. Securing a career in this field means staying ahead of the curve.The Future of Work is Digital 💡📌 46% of UK businesses struggle to recruit due to a lack of digital skills (UK Parliament)📌 £47K+ – The average UK software developer salary (Indeed)📌 85 million jobs are at risk of automation (World Economic Forum)At ThirdWaveICT, we build full-stack websites, static websites, and apps, if you're looking for expertise, let’s connect! If you’re exploring Django and full-stack development, I’d love to share insights.📢 Want to future-proof your career?Become a highly employable software developer in the UK with a globally recognised Level 5 hashtag#Diploma in hashtag#Web hashtag#Applications hashtag#Development → Code Institute South Staffordshire College soon City of Wolverhampton College lals@wolvcoll.ac.uk hashtag#WebDevelopment hashtag#Python hashtag#ECommerce hashtag#APIs hashtag#Automation hashtag#TechCareers hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#CareerGrowth

🔥 𝗨𝘀𝗲 𝗚𝗼𝗼𝗴𝗹𝗲 𝗗𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗙𝗶𝗻𝗱 𝗝𝗼𝗯𝘀 𝗼𝗻 𝗟𝗶𝗻𝗸𝗲𝗱𝗜𝗻Most job seekers rely only on LinkedIn’s job search feature, but did you know you can find hidden job listings using Google?LinkedIn’s built-in search doesn’t always show all available jobs. That’s where Google Dorking (advanced search operators) comes in!𝗧𝗿𝘆 𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗚𝗼𝗼𝗴𝗹𝗲 𝗦𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗰𝗵 𝗤𝘂𝗲𝗿𝘆:👉 site:linkedin.com/jobs "job title" "location"🔹 𝗘𝘅𝗮𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗲:site:linkedin.com/jobs "Cybersecurity Analyst" "Gothenburg"🔹 𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗗𝗼𝗲𝘀:This tells Google to search ONLY within LinkedIn’s job postings and show results even if LinkedIn’s own algorithm hides them from you.𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝘁𝗼 𝗖𝘂𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗜𝘁 𝗙𝘂𝗿𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗿📌 Search for specific companies:site:linkedin.com/jobs "Cloud Security Engineer" "Microsoft"📌 Find jobs posted recently:site:linkedin.com/jobs "SOC Analyst" "Gothenburg" after:2024-02-01📌 Include remote jobs:site:linkedin.com/jobs "Penetration Tester" "Remote" OR "Work from Home"𝗪𝗵𝘆 𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗪𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀LinkedIn’s job search prioritizes sponsored posts and algorithm-based suggestions, meaning you might never see some job listings. Google, on the other hand, indexes everything, letting you bypass LinkedIn’s limitations and find jobs others might miss!🚀 𝗧𝗿𝘆 𝗶𝘁 𝗻𝗼𝘄 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘂𝗻𝗹𝗼𝗰𝗸 𝗺𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗷𝗼𝗯 𝗼𝗽𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁𝘂𝗻𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀!🔁 Share this with someone who’s job hunting!hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#GoogleDork hashtag#LinkedInHacks hashtag#CareerGrowth CyberSecurity Jobs Cyber Security Champions

Interceptores 💡 Me tope con el uso de interceptores en distintos proyectos, y me pareció de suma utilidad.Los interceptores en Entity Framework Core permiten capturar y modificar operaciones de base de datos antes o después de que ocurran. Son ideales para auditar, loguear, o incluso modificar consultas en tiempo de ejecución sin afectar la lógica del repositorio.📌 Cuándo usarlo:✔️ Para registrar consultas lentas o detectar ineficiencias✔️ Implementar lógica de auditoría sin modificar el código del repositorio✔️ Evitar SQL Injection validando consultas antes de ejecutarlasEn mi caso, fue clave para identificar consultas que sobrecargaban la cpu del servidor y que requerian algun rediseño para evitarlo.------------------------------------------------------------------------------Interceptors 💡Entity Framework Core interceptors allow you to capture and modify database operations before or after they occur. They are ideal for auditing, logging, or even modifying queries at runtime without affecting repository logic.📌 When to use it:✔️ To log slow queries or detect inefficiencies✔️ Implement audit logic without modifying the repository code✔️ Avoid SQL Injection by validating queries before executing themIn my case, it was key to identifying queries that were overloading the server's CPU and that required some redesign to avoid it.hashtag#Interceptors hashtag#NET hashtag#C hashtag#EntityFramework

When you - as I am - are on a job hunt (or selling to new clients) it is always interesting to see, who will pick up the phone when you give a call to busy senior leaders in busy companies. I must say, that it has been a very positive experience. February has been busy with coffee meetings, and great contacts in the network. Thank you to all coffee meeting participants (leaders and companies) for your advice and time. Also many thanks to all of you who have liked, shared and written comments, called me and provided ideas, leads and support in many other ways (also from colleagues). I have learned that the wider the "Open for New Opportunities" LinkedIn post can be shared the better. I have also learned that a personal/physical 1:1 meeting between people is still highly valuableThe ongoing talks have provided me with good memories - and new magic moments  -  when reconnecting with network relations, new business contacts, headhunters and people who I - in some cases - may not have seen for a while. The positive dialogues are much appreciated. Today Partner Bettina Bencke, and Manager Birthe Bülow from Bencke & Partners, who are working with headhunting and recruiting, kindly hosted a coffee meeting in central Copenhagen. Thank you to Birthe Bülow for providing inspiration, professional insights and excellent advice for the continued journey towards the next job, within one of the following areas, as described on my LinkedIn profile:1) General management of business units/teams 2) Project management of multi-disciplinary technology/business projects or business transformations with organisational development3) Business development, clients, sales, tenders and growthOpen for New Opportunities post on LinkedIn:https://lnkd.in/dgVXCwFmFurther info can be found on my LinkedIn profile: "International business man with strong market, technology and communication skills". https://lnkd.in/drKa-cFT

Mastering hashtag#FullStackDevelopment with hashtag#Django!Web development has come a long way, and so has my journey with it! From building my first website in 1998 for Stow Heath Primary School (thanks to Dave Whyley and Gavin Hawkins) to teaching dynamic web design at Bilston College in 1999, I’ve seen the industry evolve drastically. Back then, I self-learned ASP.NET and PHP, CSS, HTML, Javscript, HCI, etc teaching HND and Foundation Degree courses at the City of Wolverhampton College and the University of Wolverhampton having held the youngest lecture accolade too.Fast forward to today, and building full-stack web applications has never been easier! Got me thinking I have not produced a CV in a long time - and I was asked to showcase my experience. Well being self-taught in web I have no certificates. But I have served as an External Examiner (EV) and Internal Verifier (IV)  and OSCA for multiple institutions, including the University of Wolverhampton, Birmingham City University, Kingston University, and University of Surrey (BSc Top-Up programs) and Pearson, NCFE exam boards and written Degree modules. Plus I have worked on Innovate UK government-funded projects, developing websites for businesses and contributing to technology innovation and digital transformation. Today it's important to have certificates...Why Learn Full-Stack Development?🔹 Django Framework – A powerful backend for scalable applications🔹 APIs & Integrations – Connecting systems efficiently🔹 Automated Testing – Ensuring stability and reliability🔹 Persistent Storage – Managing relational and non-relational databases🔹 User Authentication – Securing access with login systems🔹 E-Commerce Functionality – Implementing seamless transactionsThe demand for web application development skills is growing as hashtag#AI and data-driven applications transform industries. Securing a career in this field means staying ahead of the curve.The Future of Work is Digital 💡📌 46% of UK businesses struggle to recruit due to a lack of digital skills (UK Parliament)📌 £47K+ – The average UK software developer salary (Indeed)📌 85 million jobs are at risk of automation (World Economic Forum)At ThirdWaveICT, we build full-stack websites, static websites, and apps, if you're looking for expertise, let’s connect! If you’re exploring Django and full-stack development, I’d love to share insights.📢 Want to future-proof your career?Become a highly employable software developer in the UK with a globally recognised Level 5 hashtag#Diploma in hashtag#Web hashtag#Applications hashtag#Development → Code Institute South Staffordshire College soon City of Wolverhampton College lals@wolvcoll.ac.uk hashtag#WebDevelopment hashtag#Python hashtag#ECommerce hashtag#APIs hashtag#Automation hashtag#TechCareers hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment hashtag#CareerGrowth

🔥 𝗨𝘀𝗲 𝗚𝗼𝗼𝗴𝗹𝗲 𝗗𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗙𝗶𝗻𝗱 𝗝𝗼𝗯𝘀 𝗼𝗻 𝗟𝗶𝗻𝗸𝗲𝗱𝗜𝗻Most job seekers rely only on LinkedIn’s job search feature, but did you know you can find hidden job listings using Google?LinkedIn’s built-in search doesn’t always show all available jobs. That’s where Google Dorking (advanced search operators) comes in!𝗧𝗿𝘆 𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗚𝗼𝗼𝗴𝗹𝗲 𝗦𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗰𝗵 𝗤𝘂𝗲𝗿𝘆:👉 site:linkedin.com/jobs "job title" "location"🔹 𝗘𝘅𝗮𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗲:site:linkedin.com/jobs "Cybersecurity Analyst" "Gothenburg"🔹 𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗗𝗼𝗲𝘀:This tells Google to search ONLY within LinkedIn’s job postings and show results even if LinkedIn’s own algorithm hides them from you.𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝘁𝗼 𝗖𝘂𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗜𝘁 𝗙𝘂𝗿𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗿📌 Search for specific companies:site:linkedin.com/jobs "Cloud Security Engineer" "Microsoft"📌 Find jobs posted recently:site:linkedin.com/jobs "SOC Analyst" "Gothenburg" after:2024-02-01📌 Include remote jobs:site:linkedin.com/jobs "Penetration Tester" "Remote" OR "Work from Home"𝗪𝗵𝘆 𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗪𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀LinkedIn’s job search prioritizes sponsored posts and algorithm-based suggestions, meaning you might never see some job listings. Google, on the other hand, indexes everything, letting you bypass LinkedIn’s limitations and find jobs others might miss!🚀 𝗧𝗿𝘆 𝗶𝘁 𝗻𝗼𝘄 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘂𝗻𝗹𝗼𝗰𝗸 𝗺𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗷𝗼𝗯 𝗼𝗽𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁𝘂𝗻𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀!🔁 Share this with someone who’s job hunting!hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#GoogleDork hashtag#LinkedInHacks hashtag#CareerGrowth CyberSecurity Jobs Cyber Security Champions

🚀 Ensuring Data Integrity with Data Annotations in ASP.NET MVC 🚀In ASP.NET MVC, ensuring data accuracy is crucial, and Data Annotations provide a simple yet powerful way to validate user input.🔹 What are Data Annotations?Data annotations are attributes in the System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations namespace that help define validation rules directly in the model class.🔹 Commonly Used Data Annotations:✔️ [Required] – Ensures the field is not empty✔️ [StringLength(50)] – Sets max length of a string✔️ [Range(18, 60)] – Restricts a numeric range✔️ [EmailAddress] – Validates an email format✔️ [RegularExpression(@"\d{10}")] – Custom pattern validation (e.g., 10-digit phone number)✔️ [Compare("Password")] – Ensures passwords match (useful for confirmation fields)🔹 How it Works?When a user submits a form, ModelState.IsValid checks if the data meets the annotation rules. If not, validation messages are displayed to guide the user.🎯 Why Use Data Annotations?✅ Reduces the need for complex server-side validation logic✅ Ensures consistency across application layers✅ Improves maintainability and readabilityHave you used Data Annotations in your projects? Share your thoughts! 💡hashtag#ASPNetMVC hashtag#DotNet hashtag#DataAnnotations hashtag#Validation hashtag#WebDevelopment hashtag#Coding

Interceptores 💡 Me tope con el uso de interceptores en distintos proyectos, y me pareció de suma utilidad.Los interceptores en Entity Framework Core permiten capturar y modificar operaciones de base de datos antes o después de que ocurran. Son ideales para auditar, loguear, o incluso modificar consultas en tiempo de ejecución sin afectar la lógica del repositorio.📌 Cuándo usarlo:✔️ Para registrar consultas lentas o detectar ineficiencias✔️ Implementar lógica de auditoría sin modificar el código del repositorio✔️ Evitar SQL Injection validando consultas antes de ejecutarlasEn mi caso, fue clave para identificar consultas que sobrecargaban la cpu del servidor y que requerian algun rediseño para evitarlo.------------------------------------------------------------------------------Interceptors 💡Entity Framework Core interceptors allow you to capture and modify database operations before or after they occur. They are ideal for auditing, logging, or even modifying queries at runtime without affecting repository logic.📌 When to use it:✔️ To log slow queries or detect inefficiencies✔️ Implement audit logic without modifying the repository code✔️ Avoid SQL Injection by validating queries before executing themIn my case, it was key to identifying queries that were overloading the server's CPU and that required some redesign to avoid it.hashtag#Interceptors hashtag#NET hashtag#C hashtag#EntityFramework

When you - as I am - are on a job hunt (or selling to new clients) it is always interesting to see, who will pick up the phone when you give a call to busy senior leaders in busy companies. I must say, that it has been a very positive experience. February has been busy with coffee meetings, and great contacts in the network. Thank you to all coffee meeting participants (leaders and companies) for your advice and time. Also many thanks to all of you who have liked, shared and written comments, called me and provided ideas, leads and support in many other ways (also from colleagues). I have learned that the wider the "Open for New Opportunities" LinkedIn post can be shared the better. I have also learned that a personal/physical 1:1 meeting between people is still highly valuableThe ongoing talks have provided me with good memories - and new magic moments  -  when reconnecting with network relations, new business contacts, headhunters and people who I - in some cases - may not have seen for a while. The positive dialogues are much appreciated. Today Partner Bettina Bencke, and Manager Birthe Bülow from Bencke & Partners, who are working with headhunting and recruiting, kindly hosted a coffee meeting in central Copenhagen. Thank you to Birthe Bülow for providing inspiration, professional insights and excellent advice for the continued journey towards the next job, within one of the following areas, as described on my LinkedIn profile:1) General management of business units/teams 2) Project management of multi-disciplinary technology/business projects or business transformations with organisational development3) Business development, clients, sales, tenders and growthOpen for New Opportunities post on LinkedIn:https://lnkd.in/dgVXCwFmFurther info can be found on my LinkedIn profile: "International business man with strong market, technology and communication skills". https://lnkd.in/drKa-cFT

Mastering hashtag#FullStackDevelopment with hashtag#Django!Web development has come a long way, and so has my journey with it! From building my first website in 1998 for Stow Heath Primary School (thanks to Dave Whyley and Gavin Hawkins) to teaching dynamic web design at Bilston College in 1999, I’ve seen the industry evolve drastically. Back then, I self-learned ASP.NET and PHP, CSS, HTML, Javscript, HCI, etc teaching HND and Foundation Degree courses at the City of Wolverhampton College and the University of Wolverhampton having held the youngest lecture accolade too.Fast forward to today, and building full-stack web applications has never been easier! Got me thinking I have not produced a CV in a long time - and I was asked to showcase my experience. Well being self-taught in web I have no certificates. But I have served as an External Examiner (EV) and Internal Verifier (IV)  and OSCA for multiple institutions, including the University of Wolverhampton, Birmingham City University, Kingston University, and University of Surrey (BSc Top-Up programs) and Pearson, NCFE exam boards and written Degree modules. Plus I have worked on Innovate UK government-funded projects, developing websites for businesses and contributing to technology innovation and digital transformation. Today it's important to have certificates...Why Learn Full-Stack Development?🔹 Django Framework – A powerful backend for scalable applications🔹 APIs & Integrations – Connecting systems efficiently🔹 Automated Testing – Ensuring stability and reliability🔹 Persistent Storage – Managing relational and non-relational databases🔹 User Authentication – Securing access with login systems🔹 E-Commerce Functionality – Implementing seamless transactionsThe demand for web application development skills is growing as hashtag#AI and data-driven applications transform industries. 🔥 𝗨𝘀𝗲 𝗚𝗼𝗼𝗴𝗹𝗲 𝗗𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗙𝗶𝗻𝗱 𝗝𝗼𝗯𝘀 𝗼𝗻 𝗟𝗶𝗻𝗸𝗲𝗱𝗜𝗻Most job seekers rely only on LinkedIn’s job search feature, but did you know you can find hidden job listings using Google?LinkedIn’s built-in search doesn’t always show all available jobs. That’s where Google Dorking (advanced search operators) comes in!𝗧𝗿𝘆 𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗚𝗼𝗼𝗴𝗹𝗲 𝗦𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗰𝗵 𝗤𝘂𝗲𝗿𝘆:👉 site:linkedin.com/jobs "job title" "location"🔹 𝗘𝘅𝗮𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗲:site:linkedin.com/jobs "Cybersecurity Analyst" "Gothenburg"🔹 𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗗𝗼𝗲𝘀:This tells Google to search ONLY within LinkedIn’s job postings and show results even if LinkedIn’s own algorithm hides them from you.𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝘁𝗼 𝗖𝘂𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗜𝘁 𝗙𝘂𝗿𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗿📌 Search for specific companies:site:linkedin.com/jobs "Cloud Security Engineer" "Microsoft"📌 Find jobs posted recently:site:linkedin.com/jobs "SOC Analyst" "Gothenburg" after:2024-02-01📌 Include remote jobs:site:linkedin.com/jobs "Penetration Tester" "Remote" OR "Work from Home"𝗪𝗵𝘆 𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗪𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀LinkedIn’s job search prioritizes sponsored posts and algorithm-based suggestions, meaning you might never see some job listings. Google, on the other hand, indexes everything, letting you bypass LinkedIn’s limitations and find jobs others might miss!🚀 𝗧𝗿𝘆 𝗶𝘁 𝗻𝗼𝘄 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘂𝗻𝗹𝗼𝗰𝗸 𝗺𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗷𝗼𝗯 𝗼𝗽𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁𝘂𝗻𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀!🔁 Share this with someone who’s job hunting!hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#GoogleDork hashtag#LinkedInHacks hashtag#CareerGrowth CyberSecurity Jobs Cyber Security Champions

Will disappear into the garage for a few hours and come back having built an actual working machine. 4. Doesn't play video games, he "plays" 3dsmax.5. Has an infectious excitement about things he's interested in, to the point where I think I understand some quantum physics theories because he has explained it to me with the patience of a Saint.6. Is the kind of person who meticulously plans and will see any project through from inception to completion - as will always be represented by our terraces and stoep which he insisted on building solo. "Built with my own hands" taken and executed quite literally. (I played with the wet cement - once... so technically I helped...👀)More to the point - I know for a fact: Allie is a dedicated colleague, a polymath and a software virtuoso.
